SEARCH
Package arc

Class Console

java.lang.Object
arc.Console
public class Console extends Object

ARC Console

This class allows you to create an easy to program Console window
It has simple input and ouput methods that beginner programmers can use to learn
This Console has two layers:
* Text layer controlled by print and read methods
* Graphical layer below that is controlled by draw methods

Since:
2021-01-13

    FontMetrics
    getDrawFontMetrics()
    Gets the FontMetrics object for the current bottom (draw) layer font
    Useful for getting the width of a string in pixels
    int
    getKey()
    Reads the next character pressed without waiting for the return key
    Returns an integer keycode for that character
    You can use this method to capture arrow presses or other special keys
    FontMetrics
    getTextFontMetrics()
    Gets the FontMetrics object for the current top (text) layer font
    Useful for getting the width of a string in pixels
    Font
    loadFont(String strFileName, int intSize)
    Load a font based on a filename and returns a Font object
    The object can be used in the setTextFont and setDrawFont methods
    Can only load ttf (TrueType) fonts

    loadImage(String strFileName)
    Load an image based on filename and returns a BufferedImage object
    The object can be used in the drawImage method
    Can only load jpg, png, and gif (not animated) picture files

    repaint()
    Repaints the lower draw layer
    Any draw methods that were executed before this will be finally drawn on the console draw layer
    Fill the "draw buffer" with shapes and colors and use this method to draw that buffer to the screen

      Parameters:
      strTitle - title you would like at the top of the console window

    • Console

      public Console(int intWidth, int intHeight)
      Create a Console window with specific dimensions
      Parameters:
      intWidth - desired pixel width of the new console window
      intHeight - desired pixel height of the new console window

    • Console

      public Console(String strTitle, int intWidth, int intHeight)
      Create a Console window with a specific title and dimensions
      Parameters:
      strTitle - title you would like at the top of the console window
      intWidth - desired pixel width of the new console window
      intHeight - desired pixel height of the new console window

    • drawArc

      public void drawArc(int intX, int intY, int intWidth, int intHeight, int intStartAngle, int intArcAngle)
      Draw an arc at the designated coordinates and angles
      Parameters:
      intX - x location of the start of the arc
      intY - y location of the start of the arc
      intWidth - width of the arc
      intHeight - height of the arc
      intStartAngle - start angle of the arc in degrees
      intArcAngle - angle of the arc in degrees

    • drawImage

      public void drawImage(BufferedImage theImage, int intX, int intY)
      Draw an Image at the designated coordinates
      Anchor point for the image will be top left corner
      Parameters:
      theImage - image object to draw
      intX - x location of the upper left corner of the image
      intY - y location of the upper left corner of the image

    • drawLine

      public void drawLine(int intX1, int intY1, int intX2, int intY2)
      Draw a line at the designated coordinates
      Parameters:
      intX1 - x location of the first point on the line
      intY1 - y location of the first point on the line
      intX2 - x location of the second point on the line
      intY2 - y location of the second point on the line

    • drawOval

      public void drawOval(int intX, int intY, int intWidth, int intHeight)
      Draw an oval at the designaged coordinates with the designated width and height
      Anchor point for the oval will be the top left corner
      Parameters:
      intX - x location of the upper left corner of the oval
      intY - y location of the upper left corner of the oval
      intWidth - width of the oval
      intHeight - height of the oval

    • drawPolygon

      public void drawPolygon(int[] intXPoints, int[] intYPoints, int intNPoints)
      Draw a polygon at the designated coordinates
      Parameters:
      intXPoints - array specifying the x coordinates of the polygon
      intYPoints - array specifying the y coordinates of the polygon
      intNPoints - the number of points in the polygon

    • drawRect

      public void drawRect(int intX, int intY, int intWidth, int intHeight)
      Draw a rectangle at the designated coordinates with the designated width and height
      Anchor poirnt for the rectangle will be the top left corner
      Parameters:
      intX - x location of the upper left corner of the rectangle
      intY - y location of the upper left corner of the rectangle
      intWidth - width of the rectangle
      intHeight - height of the rectangle

    • drawRoundRect

      public void drawRoundRect(int intX, int intY, int intWidth, int intHeight, int intArcWidth, int intArcHeight)
      Draw a rounded rectangle at the designated coordinates with the designated width and height
      Anchor poirnt for the rectangle will be the top left corner
      Parameters:
      intX - x location of the upper left corner of the rectangle
      intY - y location of the upper left corner of the rectangle
      intWidth - width of the rectangle
      intHeight - height of the rectangle
      intArcWidth - the width of the rounded corner arc
      intArcHeight - the height of the rounded corner arc

    • drawString

      public void drawString(String strLine, int intX, int intY)
      Draw a string at the designated coordinates
      The string will be drawn in the lower draw layer
      Parameters:
      strLine - line of text to be printed to the lower draw layer
      intX - x location of the start of the line
      intY - y location of the start of the line

    • fillArc

      public void fillArc(int intX, int intY, int intWidth, int intHeight, int intStartAngle, int intArcAngle)
      Draw a filled arc at the designated coordinates and angles
      Parameters:
      intX - x location of the start of the arc
      intY - y location of the start of the arc
      intWidth - width of the arc
      intHeight - height of the arc
      intStartAngle - start angle of the arc in degrees
      intArcAngle - angle of the arc in degrees

      intWidth - width of the oval
      intHeight - height of the oval

      Parameters:

      intYPoints - array specifying the y coordinates of the polygon
      intNPoints - the number of points in the polygon

      public void fillRect(int intX, int intY, int intWidth, int intHeight)

      Anchor poirnt for the rectangle will be the top left corner
      Parameters:
      intX - x location of the upper left corner of the rectangle

    • fillRoundRect

      public void fillRoundRect(int intX, int intY, int intWidth, int intHeight, int intArcWidth, int intArcHeight)
      Draw a filled rounded rectangle at the designated coordinates with the designated width and height
      Anchor poirnt for the rectangle will be the top left corner
      Parameters:
      intX - x location of the upper left corner of the rectangle
      intY - y location of the upper left corner of the rectangle
      intWidth - width of the rectangle
      intHeight - height of the rectangle
      intArcWidth - the width of the rounded corner arc
      intArcHeight - the height of the rounded corner arc

    • setDrawColor

      public void setDrawColor(Color theColor)
      Sets the color for the lower draw layer
      Parameters:
      theColor - color object value

    • setDrawFont

      public void setDrawFont(Font theFont)
      Sets the font for the lower draw layer
      Parameters:
      theFont - font object value

    • repaint

      public void repaint()
      Repaints the lower draw layer
      Any draw methods that were executed before this will be finally drawn on the console draw layer
      Fill the "draw buffer" with shapes and colors and use this method to draw that buffer to the screen

    • readLine

      public String readLine()
      Reads a line of text from the top layer and returns a String
      Returns:
      a String of the line that the user types into the console's top layer

    • readInt

      public int readInt()
      Reads an integer number from the top layer and returns an int
      Returns:
      an integer number of what the user types into the console's top layer

    • readDouble

      public double readDouble()
      Reads a double number from the top layer and returns a double
      Returns:
      a double number of what the user types into the console's top layer

    • readChar

      public char readChar()
      Reads a character from the top layer and returns a char
      If the user enters multiple characters before pressing enter, only the first character will be returned
      Returns:
      a character value of what the user types into the console's top layer

    • readLong

      public long readLong()
      Reads an long number from the top layer and returns an long
      Returns:
      an long number of what the user types into the console's top layer

    • readFloat

      public float readFloat()
      Reads a float number from the top layer and returns a float
      Returns:
      a float number of what the user types into the console's top layer

    • readBool

      public boolean readBool()
      Reads a true or false value from the top layer and returns a boolean
      Returns:
      a boolean of what the user types into the console's top layer

    • getChar

      public char getChar()
      Reads the next character pressed without waiting for the return key
      Returns:
      a character value of what the user types into the console

    • getKey

      public int getKey()
      Reads the next character pressed without waiting for the return key
      Returns an integer keycode for that character
      You can use this method to capture arrow presses or other special keys
      Returns:
      an integer value of the character code of what the user types into the console

    • currentChar

      public char currentChar()
      Immediately returns the current character pressed if any
      No waiting for a key to be pressed
      Can be used for realtime input
      Returns:
      a character value of what the user types into the console

    • currentKey

      public int currentKey()
      Immediately returns the current keycode pressed if any
      No waiting for a key to be pressed
      Can be used for realtime input
      Returns:
      an integer value of the character code of what the user types into the console

    • currentMouseX

      public int currentMouseX()
      Immediately returns the X location of the mouse
      Realtime input
      Returns:
      current x location of the mouse

    • currentMouseY

      public int currentMouseY()
      Immediately returns the Y location of the mouse
      Realtime input
      Returns:
      current y location of the mouse

    • currentMouseButton

      public int currentMouseButton()
      Immediately returns the current mouse button being pressed
      Realtime input
      Returns:
      current button the mouse being pressed

    • loadImage

      public BufferedImage loadImage(String strFileName)
      Load an image based on filename and returns a BufferedImage object
      The object can be used in the drawImage method
      Can only load jpg, png, and gif (not animated) picture files
      Parameters:
      strFileName - name of the image file you want to load
      Returns:
      an image object that can be used in the drawImage method

    • loadFont

      public Font loadFont(String strFileName, int intSize)
      Load a font based on a filename and returns a Font object
      The object can be used in the setTextFont and setDrawFont methods
      Can only load ttf (TrueType) fonts
      Parameters:
      strFileName - name of the font file you want to load
      intSize - size of the font you would like to load
      Returns:
      a font object that can be used to set the text font or draw font

    • closeConsole

      public void closeConsole()
      Closes the console window and exits the program

    • closeWindow

      public void closeWindow()
      Closes the console window without exiting the program
      Useful for multi-window applications

    • sleep

      public void sleep(int intMS)
      Pauses the program for the designated number of milliseconds
      Parameters:
      intMS - number of milliseconds to pause the program for

    • getTextFontMetrics

      public FontMetrics getTextFontMetrics()
      Gets the FontMetrics object for the current top (text) layer font
      Useful for getting the width of a string in pixels
      Returns:
      the FontMetrics object for the current text font

    • getDrawFontMetrics

      public FontMetrics getDrawFontMetrics()
      Gets the FontMetrics object for the current bottom (draw) layer font
      Useful for getting the width of a string in pixels
      Returns:
      the FontMetrics object for the current draw font
